meanings.definition: A sudden reversal of fortune or change in circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The peripetias in the story took the main character from riches to rags in an instant.
meanings.sent2: The novel's plot was full of peripetias that kept the readers on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent3: The peripetias in the movie made the audience gasp and laugh at the same time.
meanings.sent4: Life's peripetias can turn our world upside down when we least expect it.
meanings.sent5: The peripetias of the stock market can make or break fortunes overnight.

meanings.definition: Unexpected twists or turns in a plot or situation.
meanings.sent1: The peripetias in the mystery novel kept the readers guessing until the very end.
meanings.sent2: The peripetias of the political campaign surprised even the most seasoned analysts.
meanings.sent3: The peripetias in the comedy show had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Life's peripetias can add excitement and drama to an otherwise mundane existence.
meanings.sent5: The peripetias of fate led them on a journey they never could have imagined.
